III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10103
Section (1) A facility shall have a current written program statement which
Description specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Written policies and procedures pertaining to the admission,
care, and release of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A reported on an unknown date, an unknown staff member
touched Youth A's face and attempted to give Youth A their
address. When questioned about this statement, Youth A denied
saying this and denied that it happened.
Investigation Probation Officer was interviewed via phone on 2/27/2024. He
reported knowing about the allegations and having spoken to
Youth A about these allegations. He reported Youth A tends to
embellish stories and is presenting a pattern of making stories up.
Therapist 1 was interviewed via phone on 2/27/2024. He
reported having approximately 5 to 6 sessions to complete the
assessment on Youth A. Youth A presents stories that are hard to
believe and gave an example of Youth A reporting inhaling 30 to
35 lines of meth and cocaine daily. Youth A reported using
prescription opioids but later denied this. Therapist 1 believed this
drug report to be untrue because Youth A has never displayed
any signs of drug withdrawal.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/27/2024. He reported knowing about the allegations and Youth
A informed Therapist 2 of the allegations. Therapist 2 informed
Supervisor 1 of the allegations who reported the information to
MDHHS. Youth A had reported Staff 1 touched his face and gave
her home address to Youth A. Youth A denied these allegations
when speaking to Supervisor 1. Administrator 1 had no knowledge
of who the alleged female staff was at this time. Administrator 1
was interviewed a second time via phone on 2/28/2024. He
reported identifying Staff 1 and having Staff 1 deny the
allegations. He reported reviewing 5 of the 5 days identified Staff 1
would have been on the unit that Youth A was lodged. Youth A
was asked again about the allegations by Administrator 1 and
Youth A reported Youth A and Staff 1 were not in Youth A’s
bedroom when speaking and Staff 1 touched Youth A’s face.
Youth A suggested they were in the common area. Youth A
reported Staff 1 asked where he was from, and Staff 1 told Youth
2

A she also lives near downtown. Staff 1 was reported to be
laughing when saying Staff 1 would stop by sometime.
Complainant 1-Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at
the facility on 2/27/2024. He reported working when Therapist 2
approached him and shared the allegations of Staff 1 touched his
face and attempted to give Youth A her home address. Youth A
informed Therapist 2 of these allegations on 2/22/24. A female
staff was identified who was working on the unit Youth A is
lodged, but Youth A gave no specific date or time of the
allegations. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A has a history of “crying
wolf” and engages in a lot of attention seeking.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/27/2024. He reported the allegations were true and described
the staff as a skinny white woman with brown hair that he had
never seen before. He reported it occurred during a room check
while Staff 1 was sitting next to him on his bed in his room. Youth
A believed the incident took place a “couple of weeks or a month
ago. Youth A reported feeling uncomfortable when Staff 1 touched
his face and believed no other staff would have done that type of
behavior. Youth A also reported Staff 1 wanted to give Youth A
Staff 1’s address but never did.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/27/2024. He reported knowing who Staff 1 was after being given
a description of her. He provided the schedule and found that Staff
1 is a new staff that would have been working a shadow shift on
the unit at five different times over the past month. He reported all
staff are trained to not provide any type of personal information to
the youth.
Complainant 2 -Therapist 2 was interviewed via phone on
2/28/2024. She reported being Youth A’s primary therapist and he
provided the allegations to her during a session. She reported
being told the incident occurred before bedtime on the unit and
Youth A reported Staff 1 had been flirting with Youth A prior to the
alleged incident. Youth A reported Staff 1 gave Youth A Staff 1’s
personal address at a later time.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/28/2024. Staff 2 was interviewed because he was present on
the unit during the time Staff 1 was sitting at the table with Youth
A. He reported Staff 1 was shadowing him as part of her training
and he never observed Staff 1 touch Youth A. Staff 2 reported if
he heard Staff 1 talk about her home address, he would have
3

pulled her away from the youth and informed Staff 1 that it is
inappropriate to provide personal information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/28/2024. She denied touching any of the youth since working at
the facility. She reported Youth A asked her where she lived, and
Staff 1 told Youth A that Staff 1 lives in the area. Staff 1
remembers the shift in question and reported knowing that staff
are not to provide any personal information to the youth. She
reported having two more weeks of shadow training before she
will be a full-time staff member.
Documents Reviewed:
Video Recording (dated 2/12/24 providing a view of the
common area on the unit) review: On 2/12/24 Youth A and Staff
1 were identified as siting at a table with another youth in the
common area. They were at the table for approximately 22
minutes before Staff 1 stood up and walked away. Staff 1 never
touches Youth A. Also, there is nothing on the audio recording
indicating Staff 1 wants to give an address to Youth A. When Staff
1 walks away, Youth A turns several times to watch her walk
away. There was no video of Staff 1 entering any of the youth’s
bedrooms and a video of each day Staff 1 was on the unit were
reviewed.
Detention Procedures Manual – Personnel Regulations 800.1
XIX Relationship with resident dated 2/25/19. This document
outlines a relationship between a staff member and a resident
should always be professional. Personal involvement of a non-
professional nature must be avoided, and staff members are not
permitted to become socially involved with court wards.
Detention Procedures Manual – Administrative .3 Standards
of conduct dated 8/21/12. This document outlines the standards
represented in the professional code of ethics applicable to all
employees. Staff are to conduct themselves at all times in a
professional manner.
Detention Procedures Manual –Resident Management 600.6
dated 8/24/16. This document outlines the rights of all detained
juveniles. The youth have the right to expect they shall be treated
respectfully by staff.
Analysis Based upon interviews, written documentation and video
recording review there is no evidence that supports Staff 1
4

violated the facility policy of providing personal information about
herself nor touching a youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
